page.title: 15Seaton Parish Council
page.content:
Each village has its own Parish Council, which is the basic unit of local government in rural England today. The Parish Council must not be confused with the Parochial Church Council, which runs the local church. This information came from Mr Biggs, who is the local chairman.
Seaton Parish Council is very small, and does not have many powers. It deals with local village matters, of which the village hall seems to be the most important. The Council meets every three months, and only 5 people regularly attend the meetings, unless a matter of special interest is on the agenda.
